metadata.feature_description: Exclude search engine crawlers from Active Directory authentication

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Extensions > Authentication Systems > DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication > Site Settings
steps.expected: AD Authentication settings page loads with Search Bots field visible
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Site Settings tab showing the 'Allowed Search Bots' field

steps.action: Verify the Allowed Search Bots field displays the default value
steps.expected: Field shows default value 'gsa-crawler;MS Search 5.0 Robot'
steps.actual: Field displayed with default value 'gsa-crawler;MS Search 5.0 Robot' as expected

steps.action: Modify the Search Bots value by adding 'Googlebot' to the list
steps.expected: Value can be modified to add custom bot user agents
steps.actual: Successfully changed value to 'gsa-crawler;MS Search 5.0 Robot;Googlebot'

steps.action: Click 'Update Authentication Settings' to save changes
steps.expected: Settings are saved and the new value persists
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, page refreshed and retained the modified value

observations: The Search Bots field uses a semicolon-delimited format for specifying multiple bot user agents
Code review (AuthenticationModule.cs:84-105) confirms the HTTP_USER_AGENT is checked against the configured bot strings, and if a match is found, AD authentication is bypassed
Default value 'gsa-crawler;MS Search 5.0 Robot' is set in Settings.ascx.cs when field is empty
Testing actual bot bypass behavior would require simulating requests with specific user agent strings, which is beyond UI testing scope
